segments.en: Numbered Discourses 1
6. Finger Snap
“This mind, mendicants, is radiant.
But it is corrupted by passing corruptions.
An uneducated ordinary person does not truly understand this.
So I say that the uneducated ordinary person has no development of the mind.”
“This mind, mendicants, is radiant.
And it is freed from passing corruptions.
An educated noble disciple truly understands this.
So I say that the educated noble disciple has development of the mind.”
“If, mendicants, a mendicant cultivates a mind of love even as long as a finger snap,
they’re called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu arittajjhāno viharati satthusāsanakaro ovādapatikaro, amoghaṃ raṭṭhapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjati’.
segments.en: a mendicant who does not lack absorption, who follows the Teacher’s instructions, who responds to advice, and who does not eat the country’s alms in vain.

segments.pli: Ko pana vādo ye naṃ bahulīkarontī”ti.
segments.en: How much more so those who make much of it!”

segments.pli: “Accharāsaṅghātamattampi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mettācittaṃ manasi karoti;
segments.en: “If, mendicants, a mendicant focuses on a mind of love even as long as a finger snap,
they’re called

segments.pli: ‘bhikkhu arittajjhāno viharati satthusāsanakaro ovādapatikaro amoghaṃ raṭṭhapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjati’.
segments.en: a mendicant who does not lack absorption, who follows the Teacher’s instructions, who responds to advice, and who does not eat the country’s alms in vain.

segments.pli: Ko pana vādo ye naṃ bahulīkarontī”ti.
segments.en: How much more so those who make much of it!”

segments.pli: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, dhammā akusalā akusalabhāgiyā akusalapakkhikā, sabbe te manopubbaṅgamā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, whatever qualities are unskillful, part of the unskillful, on the side of the unskillful, all of them are preceded by the mind.

segments.pli: Mano tesaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭhamaṃ uppajjati, anvadeva akusalā dhammā”ti.
segments.en: Mind arises first, and unskillful qualities follow right behind.”

segments.pli: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, dhammā kusalā kusalabhāgiyā kusalapakkhikā, sabbe te manopubbaṅgamā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, whatever qualities are skillful, part of the skillful, on the side of the skillful, all of them are preceded by the mind.

segments.pli: Mano tesaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭhamaṃ uppajjati, anvadeva kusalā dhammā”ti.
segments.en: Mind arises first, and skillful qualities follow right behind.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, pamādo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like negligence.

segments.pli: Pamattassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
segments.en: When you’re negligent, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, appamādo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like diligence.

segments.pli: Appamattassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
segments.en: When you’re diligent, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, kosajjaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like laziness.

segments.pli: Kusītassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
segments.en: When you’re lazy, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
